thread.title: Single girl child quota to be expanded to PG courses in DU - EducationTimes.com
thread.title_full: Single girl child quota to be expanded to PG courses in DU - EducationTimes.com

title: Single girl child quota to be expanded to PG courses in DU - EducationTimes.com
text:
Your Company
Open menu
Single girl child quota to be expanded to PG courses in DU
In the 2024-25 academic year, as many as 849 students from undergraduate programmes were able to secure seats under the SGC quota, which is a spike from the 764 students in the previous session
Share
Bookmark
Share
TNN
| Posted June 12, 2025 12:47 PM
Delhi University (DU) plans to extend its single girl child (SGC) quota to postgraduate (PG) programmes starting with the 2025-26 academic session. This initiative aims to bridge the gender gap in higher education by making it more accessible.
The policy, which was first introduced for undergraduate (UG) admissions in 2023-24, reserves one supernumerary seat in each PG course for a woman student who is the sole girl child in her family. Currently, 77 PG programmes are offered by DU, with admissions managed through the Common University Entrance Test for PG (CUET-- PG), followed by placements via the Common Seat Allocation System (CSAS).
A DU official informed TOI that this initiative aims to create an environment that emphasises the contributions of girls. The goal is to help them advance in their education without facing barriers and to make higher education more accessible for all girls by ensuring they have equal opportunities.
This initiative is part of DU's broader commitment to inclusion, which includes supernumerary quotas for various categories such as sportspersons, persons with disabilities, orphans, children and widows of armed forces personnel.
In the 2024-25 academic year, as many as 849 students were able to secure seats under the SGC quota, which is a spike from the 764 students in the previous session. Now, this quota will also apply at the postgraduate level.
Delhi University is set to kick off the first phase of undergraduate admissions this week as part of the Common Seat Allocation System (CSAS). Admission will be based solely on the CUET-UG 2025 scores.
During this initial phase, candidates are required to provide their personal and academic information, upload essential documents, such as category, EWS, or PwD certificates, and verify their CUET scores, which are automatically connected to their profiles. Applicants must log in with their CUET roll number to complete the process.
